channel.title: Computer broke down! FUC*!
channel.description:
HELLO. RIGHT NOW IM PISSED OFF.
I will try to be calm... okay lets start.
I had an Acer Aspire e380 I wanted to run a minecraft server on for some friends. Before I got to the transfer it froze. Now the computer freeze after about 30secs after boot. EVERY FCKING TIME!!! It pisses me off. Why? Okay I will try to explain what weird things I have done to the computer and what it have done to me. I have installed more ram. Standard is a AMD Athleon 64 x2 4800+ It has 2x 320GB HDD And 2GB DDR ll RAM (witch I upgraded to 4GB RAM) Two cd cases and a lot off specifications. Uses nVidiea and OsForce 7600GS 256MB
It is running windows vista.
now lets take it from the start.
First I had ubuntu on it. When trying to upgrade to Ubuntu 11.04 with the update manager I manged to install it over the backupharddisk (2nd 320GB harddisk) and got a fault. Now the harddisk is broke. Then I upgraded succesfully with the first harddisk and then had one working harddisk with ubuntu 11.04 on it. Then I desided to split up the harddisk to install windows and ubuntu on it. So I did. Got that working out pretty good. Then I just did a clean install of windows vista home premium. I then had a 320GB harddisk with windows vista home premium on it. Oh I forgot. After the crash with ubuntu the computer was starting to make strange sounds. Like shutoffsound. It powers up then make this shutoffsound then starts to power up again. The computer didn't turn off. But the sound was still there. I just ignored it. Back to the clean windows vista part. I just used it as a regular computer and then suddenly when I had some friends over at visit. I froze. Then make this weird shutdown sound. Now it freeze 30secs after boot on every boot.
I am not exactly sure why. But all I can say is I really want this fixed. I need that computer.
If anybody would been kind and help me I would have been very happy :)
Might be some burnt display drivers or anything like that. Just try to help me :)
Thank you
-Kneistol

item.title: Computer broke down! FUC*!
item.dc:creator: @HcoJustin HcoJustin
item.description:
@HcoJustin wrote:

[quote=“kneistol, post:15, topic:427932”]I have a laptop I post from. I just need the computer for home use. It’s freezing like the way it was. If I play minecraft. It freezes on minecraft. nothing changes besides everything is still.
Will try the harddrive later today. When I get home from school :D[/quote]

I think you misunderstood what he meant by POST… If you can boot into windows and log in, my guess would have to be a bad PSU… From what you’ve told us it seems to crash when it comes under heavy use?

Read full topic

item.title: Computer broke down! FUC*!
item.dc:creator: @Rictoo Rictoo
item.description:
@Rictoo wrote:

Does it freeze after it begins to boot the operating system? Or does it freeze during POST (when there’s either a manufacturer splash screen or white text on a black background)? Either way, try unplugging the hard-drive and booting up that way. If it still freezes you might have a PSU problem.

Edit: If the computer still shuts off with an unplugged hard-drive, there are ways of determining whether it’s a PSU problem or not (or you can just try someone else’s PSU if there’s one available). Report back.

Read full topic

EDIT:

Home and tried

It didn’t worked I started the computer checked the spesifications. It was 2GB ram instead of 4. But It still froze.
Lasted longer this time though. Got time to log in and check my facebook
I got the annoying shutdownsound off though. By removing the destroyed harddisk. So no longer the irritating sound. Just that my computer freeze after about 10 minutes :D[/quote]
If it still freezes i suggest you just sell the working parts and try some money you waste on a acer.

t4:

don’t buy an acer

I think the obvious first step in troubleshooting would be to remove the new ram and see if the problem still exists
